channel.title: LeetCode on Xueshan Chen
channel.description: Recent content in LeetCode on Xueshan Chen

item.title: Two Sum
item.description: leetcode link note time complexity should less than $O(n^2)$ only one valid answer my solution in python class Solution(object): def twoSum(self, nums, target): """ :type nums: List[int] :type target: int :rtype: List[int] """ n = 0; for i,m in enumerate(nums): n = target - m for j,v in enumerate(nums): if (n == v): return [i,j] return the enumerate() function is used to get the index and the value at one time from an array the time complexity is $O(n^2)$ Better solution from other def twoSum(self, nums, target): d = {} for i, n in enumerate(nums): m = target - n if m in d: return [d[m], i] else: d[n] = i the time complexity is only $O(n)$
